summary: PRV-associated respiratory infections may be prevalent in Southeast Asia. the clinical course of PRV is not fully elucidated. virulence, pathology, and pathogenesis of two PRV strains were investigated. the presence of PRV cases in Southeast Asia suggests that PRV might be the causative viral pathogen of RTI. the prevalence of human PRV infection in Southeast Asia may be higher than previously thought. PRV-neutralizing antibodies were also detected in 83% of fruit bat species (R. amplexicaudatus, E. spelaea, and Macroglossus minimus) in the Philippines. it is still not known whether PRV causes illnesses in fruit bats. bat-borne PRV is a potentially pathogenic to humans.
